pROFILE sCHOOL
HOME OF THE PATRIOTS

div.a: The last day of instruction is May 29th. The last official day of school is June 5th. Remote instruction will remain in effect until the end of the 19-20 school year. A graduation ceremony will take place June 5th (Rain date: June 6th). Stay tuned for details!

strong.font: Parents, please read an important letter

div.span:
The school building is currently staffed on Monday and Wednesdays to handle mail, clerical work and physical operations of the buildings. Phone calls may be able to be taken during that time, (603) 991-4189, but if we are not able to answer, an administrator will respond within 24 hours.
SAU Office #35 is closed to public until further notice. Contact information can be accessed

a.span: How to Access Your Teachers Online

td.div:
Thanks to the generous support of the Abbie Greenleaf Library in Franconia, a free virtual library card is available to all Profile School students so that they may access audio and eBooks through Overdrive--New Hampshire. Anyone interested in this opportunity, should contact the library director, Ann Steuernagel by email at info@abbielibrary.org
​
Another literary resource is the National Emergency Library, a collection of books that supports emergency remote teaching, research activities, independent scholarship, and intellectual stimulation while universities, schools, training centers, and libraries are closed. To learn more, visit this page from Internet Archive Blog.
This page explains what is available and how to use the resource. To sign up for a free account and start borrowing books, please visit https://archive.org/account/signup

font.strong: Need to use Zoom? Watch a video tutorial below:

div.font:
IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO DONATE YOUR "BOX TOPS FOR EDUCATION", WE WILL GLADLY TAKE THEM! PLEASE DROP THEM OFF IN THE FRONT OFFICE. THANK YOU.
​

font.font: THE PROFILE BOOSTER CLUB IS OPEN TO ALL PARENTS WHO WOULD LIKE TO BE INVOLVED. V

strong.font: ​Click Here to Donate to the Profile Patriots Spirit Squad Club

span.span:
The USDA is currently allowing us to provide all local children under the age of 18 with free breakfast and lunch from a limited Fresh Picks Cafe menu, meaning children not of school age can also receive free meals. By signing up through the "Order Here" button above, you are indicating that you wish to receive two free meals a day, 7 days a week, for the duration of the school closure, including vacation breaks.
​

Meals for each week day will be delivered to students’ homes during the morning hours, after 9 a.m. Meals for the weekend will be delivered with Friday's meals. In an effort to avoid person-to-person contact, the school staff member making the delivery will knock on the door at each residence and leave the food parcel there. If a high volume of orders are received, meals may have to be picked up at determined location and time. We will communicate changes such as these on our website or by directly contacting those who have placed orders.

br.br:
A weekly menu will be posted on the home page as well as the cafe services page of the school’s website. To indicate that you wish to receive weekday meals, please fill out this Google Form. If you have any trouble filling out the form or you need to make changes to your already submitted order, please email Jill Boyle at jiboyl@profile.k12.nh.us.
​Parents can also now apply for free & reduced meal prices that will carry over to October of the next school year. The form can be found linked above as well as on the Cafe Services web page. If you have any questions or concerns, contact the school’s main office at 603-823-7411. ​

br.span: Read 3/16 press release concerning NHIAA updates
br.br:
Profile Annual Meeting - Postponed, TBD
No SAT and PSAT's (see announcement regarding June 6th SAT sign ups in left panel)
April 4th ACT rescheduled for June 13th
(No longer at Profile; Nearby test sites can be found on ACT.org)
​
NHMEA Middle School Festival - May 9th

div.br:
The last day of instruction in May 29th. The last official day of school is June 5th.
Profile School is on the leader board for top schools in the state! Check out our ranking on USNews's Best High Schools Report!
Per the governor's mandate, remote instruction will continue through the end of the school year. A graduation ceremony has been planned for June 5th with a rain date of June 6th. Stay tuned for more details.
We will be sending meals for all 7 days a week now. On Fridays, students will receive meals for 3 days. We will also be providing meals throughout the vacation week. It is not too late to start participating! You only need to sign up one time and service will continue as long as the USDA program is in effect. This is available to anyone 18 years and younger, so children not yet of school age can get meals. Just indicate the need on the order form.
ATTENTION JUNIOR PARENTS: Please read this important message from your child's school counselor.
The White Mountains SAU #35 office is closed to everyone other
than SAU office employees. Please contact the SAU office by phone (444-3925) or email businessoffice@sau35.org.
Junior's: Please put the June 6th SAT national test on your radar! Sign up ASAP at https://collegereadiness.collegeboard.org/sat/register/june-2020
